intro: Haplolobus floribundus subsp. salomonensis, commonly known as the Solomon Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Solomon Islands. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue and violet. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its delicate, herbaceous growth habit. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
